alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN ST. LOUIS, NORTHEASTERN CARLTON AND NORTHERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM CDT... At 645 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cloquet, to near Scanlon, to Oliver, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oliver around 650 PM CDT. Proctor around 655 PM CDT. Wisconsin Point and Pike Lake Near Duluth around 700 PM CDT. Superior and Hermantown around 705 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include City of Rice Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.
